title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message: Fan spin for about 20 seconds. I believe I'm getting all the other vcore rails but noticed 0V @PPVCORE_S0_AXG diode there to Ground is 0V. Can I isolate and then run voltage to find the short? I noticed a ton of caps would be possible otherwise?...

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message:
"PPVCORE_S0_AXG diode there to Ground is 0V"
You are not curious to compare with good board?
i7 CPU is aprox 1 ohm to ground, as normal.

AXG voltage usually appears under high graphics load...

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message: AHHHH... ok. well chasing down rabbit holes. THis shows USB activity (flashing on usb drive) but can't get a pram reset out of it or chime... No image/backlight. Had the heatsink off would that cause turn off as soon as 20 seconds?

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message: CPU overheats, put back heatsink.

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message:
PPVCCSA_S0_CPU is .97V
PPCPuVCCIO_SO_REG_R is 1V
Man I'm having a hard time figuring out if those are good enough. No good board for reference

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message:
When this board really boots, VCORE drops to 0.78V aprox.
Check voltage on output pin of L7510/20.
If you get USB activity, board boots; but VCORE doesn't respect known patron in your case.

Board still turns off in 20s?

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message:
L7510/20 both at 1.12V
Sorry forgot to mention no USB activity detected.
Board does not turn off now that the heatsink is back on.

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message:
Try each RAM slot separately.
Do you have DDR3 test card?
Also try known good BIOS.

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message:
Nice! Ram card was doing something to prevent stop progress at least. Switching Ram card out (either slot) I now get USB activity. BIOS Chip was swapped already today.

no chime/display image/backlight. No external display activity detected. Smc reset registers. Cant get it to pram reset.

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message: Given there's USB activity but no sign of boot/chime/POST where would I go next on this?

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message:
"there's USB activity"
For sure?
Flashing Link LED from USB boot pendrive?

"BIOS Chip was swapped already"
Picked from working board?
Even then, ME region must be cleaned...

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message:
Voltage to USB only. NO flashing light to indicate activity.

I did reflash the bios with cleanme no change. WOn't pram reset only SMC. NO chime. Fans start slow and eventually work their way to full high speed.

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message: Did you check RAM slots with DDR3 test card?

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message: I didn't have a test card or even know they exited... ordered one and I get all lights both sides for both slots.

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message: PLT_RESET_L comes high?

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message: No. PLT_RESET_L is 0V

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message: Check CPU_PWRGD and PM_MEM_PWRGD.

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message:
cpu pwrgd = 1.05V
PM_MEM_PWRGD = 1.5V

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message: Check MEM/CPU_RESET_L.

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message:
mem_reset_L 1.5V
CPU_MEM RESET_L 1.5V

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message:
Something pulls down PLT_RESET_L.
If is not PCH, there are many resistors distributing this signal on the board.
Not easy to find a culprit.
Try first removing U2680.

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message:
Guessing its the PCH not sending signal...
Tried pulling U2680, R2689/81/83/71/88/80 and U2810. PLT_RESET_L remained low in all cases.

title: 820-3115 No PPVCORE_SO_AXG
message: You can change it...
